speakers.name: Ryan Florence
speakers.title: Co-founder
speakers.headerBio: Co-creator of React Router, co-founder of React Training, and co-founder of Remix.

speakers.name: Jenn Creighton
speakers.title: Senior Engineer
speakers.bio: Jenn Creighton is a senior engineer at Netflix and conference speaker. She lives in New York where she co-organizes useReactNYC, a community-focused React meetup in NYC. Her most recent project is raising her Dachshund puppy, Sailor Moon. You can find her online @gurlcode.
speakers.headerBio: World-renowned speaker & Senior engineer at Netflix

speakers.name: Kent C. Dodds
speakers.title: Director of Developer Experience
speakers.bio: Kent C. Dodds is a world renowned speaker, teacher, and trainer and he's actively involved in the open source community as a maintainer and contributor of hundreds of popular npm packages. Kent is a Co-Founder and Director of Developer Experience at Remix. He is the creator of EpicReact.Dev and TestingJavaScript.com. He's an instructor on egghead.io and Frontend Masters. He's also a Google Developer Expert. Kent is happily married and the father of four kids. He likes his family, code, JavaScript, and React.
speakers.headerBio: Kent C. Dodds is a world-renowned speaker, teacher, and trainer who is actively involved in the open source community as a maintainer and contributor of hundreds of popular npm packages.

speakers.name: Wes Bos
speakers.title: Engineer & Entrepreneur
speakers.talkAbstract: Get Ready for a jam packed hour of tasty web development treats. Wes Bos and Scott Tolinski will record a live version of their popular weekly podcast that will include audience participation, web development trivia, terrible jokes and prizes to be won!
speakers.bio: Wes is a prolific educator, conference speaker, workshop instructor, and co-host of the popular Syntax.fm podcast. He loves creating educational courses on web development. He lives and works in Hamilton, Canada.
speakers.headerBio: Wes is a prolific educator, conference speaker, workshop instructor, and co-host of the popular Syntax.fm podcast. He loves creating educational courses on web development.

speakers.name: Lee Robinson
speakers.title: Director of DevRel
speakers.bio: Lee is a developer, writer, and course creator. He currently works at Vercel as Director of Developer Relations, helping to educate and grow the Next.js community. He frequently speaks about front-end development, design, and the future of the web.
speakers.headerBio: World-renowned speaker, engineer, YouTuber, and Director of DevRel at Vercel

speakers.name: Swizec Teller
speakers.title: Software Engineer
speakers.talkTitle: Serverless for frontend engineers in 10 minutes
speakers.bio: Swizec is a software engineer, author, educator, and conference speaker. He's published books on modern web technologies, data visualization, and productivity, and has trained engineering teams at Fortune500 companies. Now he's distilling 20 years of tacit experience into actionable steps.
speakers.headerBio: Swizec is a prolific engineer, technical instructor, blogger, conference speaker, and author.

speakers.name: Lydia Hallie
speakers.title: Software Engineer
speakers.bio: Lydia Hallie is a full-time software engineering consultant and  educator that primarily works with JavaScript, React, Node, GraphQL, and serverless technologies. She also spends her time mentoring and doing in-person training sessions.
speakers.headerBio: Lydia Hallie is a full-time software engineering consultant and  educator that primarily works with JavaScript, React, Node, GraphQL, and serverless technologies.

speakers.name: Scott Tolinski
speakers.title: Engineer & Entrepreneur
speakers.talkAbstract: Get Ready for a jam packed hour of tasty web development treats. Wes Bos and Scott Tolinski will record a live version of their popular weekly podcast that will include audience participation, web development trivia, terrible jokes and prizes to be won!
speakers.bio: Scott is a prolific educator, conference speaker, workshop instructor, and co-host of the popular Syntax.fm podcast. He loves creating educational courses on web development through leveluptutorials.com. He lives and works in Denver, Colorado.
speakers.headerBio: Scott is a prolific educator, conference speaker, YouTuber, workshop instructor, and co-host of the popular Syntax.fm podcast.

mc.name: Anjana Vakil
mc.title: Engineer
mc.bio: Anjana suffers from a chronic case of curiosity, which led her from philosophy to English teaching to computational linguistics to software development. As a full-stack software developer at Observable, these days she codes from her home base in San Francisco; in the before-times, you could find her speaking at events around the world. She loves to share the joy of programming and advocate for a more diverse, equitable, and ethical tech industry. Ask her about the Recurse Center & Outreachy, sheâ€™s an alumna of both!
mc.headerBio: Anjana is a prolific engineer, conference speaker, and advocate for Recurse Center & Outreachy.
